Description: Terracotta scaraboid-mould in orange brown Nile clay. Unusually large and flat cake-shaped mould. Internal shape has usual smooth band above area for mould impression itself, but little trace remains of the details of the scaraboid apart from the general shape.
Dimensions: Depth: 1.30 centimetres (depth of impression from surface of mould)
Curator's comments: The Naukratite provenance is uncertain due to the rather unusual shapes of the mould and the impression.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OJ.23) (phase 2)
Condition: Fair though impression could be quite eroded
